data.title: From Chile To The World: 70 Years of Gabriela Mistral's Nobel Prize
data.text:
De Chile al Mundo : 70 años del Premio Nobel de Gabriela Mistral

Marjorie Agosín and Gloria Garafulich-Grabois, Editors

This book - a side by side bilingual edition in Spanish and English - highlights the importance of Gabriela Mistral's Nobel Prize for Chile, for Latin America and for women writers. It includes a chronology, interviews, poetry, prose, a collection of essays by important contributors, references, and photographs. The selection of poetry and prose is representative of Mistral's work published up to the time of the Nobel Prize. Published by the Gabriela Mistral Foundation, this book allows Spanish and English language readers to meet Gabriela Mistral and rediscover her work.

"A superb contribution to Gabriela Mistral studies, an incomparable resource for students and researchers, and a very readable book."

— Prof. Barbara Mujica, Georgetown University

"A beautiful constellation of Mistral's poetic production, biographic references, and literary contributions. Suitable for college and university settings apart from being a small treasure for readers and admirers of Mistral in general."

— Dr. Inella Selimovic, Wellesley College

· ISBN-13: 978-0-692-497623 · ISBN 0692497625 · Print format (PAPERBACK) · 481 pages ·

· English/Spanish edition · Published 2015 by the Gabriela Mistral Foundation ·
